website_summaries.verdict: While there's no compelling reason to buy it over the Kindle Touch, the Sony Reader Wi-Fi is a very solid e-reader.
pros: The Sony Reader Wi-Fi PRS-T1 is a compact and lightweight touch-screen e-book reader

It offers access to large catalog of e-books, magazines, and newspapers via Sony's online store, plus online loaners from your local library, has support for EPUB files, and is compatible with any e-book store that uses the Adobe DRM format
This Reader also offers audio capabilities and has a microSD card expansion slot, and its battery lasts for up to five weeks on a single charge with Wi-Fi off
cons: At $149, the PRS-T1 costs $50 more than the $99 Kindle Touch and it doesn't offer some of the little extras, like 3G wireless, e-book lending, and social-media integration, that competing e-readers offer
The Sony bookstore isn't as extensive as Amazon.com's, and the Sony Reader app isn't currently available on the iPhone and iPad

customer_reviews.title: ... Calibre to format your ebooks and this is a fantastic little reader
customer_reviews.text: Arm yourself with Calibre to format your ebooks and this is a fantastic little reader. Supports many filetypes, doesn't have awful advertising/proprietary crap, does everything I want it to and then some. I've never had a dictionary built into my books before and I'm addicted. It's fabulous. The only downside is it occasionally bogs down somehow (not quite clear on what triggers it) causing page "turns" to slow to a crawl, although rebooting fixes it. I just wish they made a bigger one!
customer_reviews.author: Caillean

customer_reviews.title: Super light, easy to use, and (sadly) discontinued
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for myself and one for my nephew. I love the fact that I can get to the battery, to replace it when needed, though that may be a while yet. I also like the buttons at the bottom, for page navigation, and it is VERY light weight!!
customer_reviews.author: K. E. Hawes

customer_reviews.title: Probably Fine For a Windows User
customer_reviews.text: The PRS-T1 does not feel very sturdy, is difficult to work with outside of Windows (I have a Linux box), and does not like to read from the micro SD card slot. It's sitting on my shelf at home, waiting until I have enough patience to clean my info off and dump it back on Amazon or E-bay.
customer_reviews.author: TLH in Tallahassee

customer_reviews.title: It's my second GREATEST eBook Reader!
customer_reviews.text: It's my second e-book reader. Previously I had the Daily Edition and although it was very comfortable to use was a bit heavy, I realized this when I had this. Very easy to use and light tops are very necessary (I had not the previous) for your protection and for night or low ambient light reading.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel-uy

customer_reviews.title: Great reader for casual/pleasure reading.
customer_reviews.text: This is much better than previous Sony readers but I wish they would make a larger screen up to 10 inch. I do like it and I recommend it if you like other 6" screen readers, an internal light like the new nook reader would be nice too, but at least the Sony lets you have audio which the nook reader with light does not. For viewing large PDF books I still have to use the Ipad, which is where I have all my college textbooks.
customer_reviews.author: LauraRN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent e-reader. With the Sony store removed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent e-reader. With the Sony store removed, all books/future purchases are linked with Kobo. The addition of stylus, SD card slot, and audio jack really make it stand out from the other e-readers. Browser is very slow and not useful. PDF files are 100% supported which includes anything being converted to PDF form, such as PowerPoint slides; however, heavy detailed pictures do take a long time to load. Overall I am satisfied with the product and would recommend to anyone using it for general reading.
customer_reviews.author: Bhavin

customer_reviews.title: It serves the purpose but it's very slow processing info ...
customer_reviews.text: It serves the purpose but it's very slow processing info. It freezes very often, I've now decided to not use the dictionary as it has frozen a few times when doing so. When it's about to run out of battery it does not turn off, it just freezes, it made me think it was broken. Having said that, it's the only reader that allows to borrow from libraries without needing a pc.
customer_reviews.author: MaJd

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first e-book reader and I love it. It got everybody in the family wanting to use it and I'm actually thinking of getting one for each of them. The only problem is the flickering, you do get used to it, but it is still somewhat annoying. I rarely use the WiFi feature and really don't think it adds that much to the reader.
customer_reviews.author: Adham Khairy

customer_reviews.title: sony e reader rocks
customer_reviews.text: i ordered my e reader and got it with free shipping. it came in two days. right out of the box i turned it on and it was as if i had been using it for years. it was that easy to use. they boasted a month of battery life. well its been a lil over a month and i havent charged it yet. there is only 1 complaint i have. it comes with this really nice stylus pen and there is no place on the reader to store it. if your reading this and wondering if you really want this. buy it. youll love it.
customer_reviews.author: dakkonderge

customer_reviews.title: I like this reader as you don't get adds shoved at ...
customer_reviews.text: Same faulty software as the one I bought several years ago. Frequently locks up, have to perform a reset each time. Battery indicator shows fully charged all the time and the battery will be discharged. I like this reader as you don't get adds shoved at you as with other readers and when it is working it is a great e-reader. Tried a PRS-T2 but it also has faulty software and no support form Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Vaioboy

customer_reviews.title: Great 16 levels of grayscale with alot of restrictions
customer_reviews.text: There are some limitations to this reader - it is only able to view pdf and epub file only (which is ok since there and many conversion softwares available) - it can only view jpeg pictures - i have read on this device continuously for the past few weeks and the battery nearly became flat after ~2.5 weeks or 4 days if the WiFi is not switched off (even if it is in stand-by mode) - the notes do not sync properly and the sony reader app takes almost 15 mins - 1/2hr just to sync my entire collection of size 900MB
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: The eReader functions perfectly, but there are defects in the background.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good device for reading. It is light weight and easy to navigate. As mentioned above, it does have some defects in the reading area, which takes some getting used to. At first it bothered me a lot, but I have learned to ignore these imperfections.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hardware, limited software
customer_reviews.text: I am quite happy with my choice of the Sony PRS-T1 e-book reader. The Sony software seems to me inferior in almost every respect to the freeware Calibre software alternative. The two together, the e-book reader and the Calibre software, provide an easy, simple and relaxing way to download, manage and read e-books.
customer_reviews.author: Arieh Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It has a very clear image to read; due to its small size its handy to take with you everywhere and it is really unexpensive. A very good option for reader fans. Absolutely advisable.
customer_reviews.author: CrisK

customer_reviews.title: Product do not function as it is
customer_reviews.text: This product can not function as it should be. Very slow, then after I copy books; it stop at all
customer_reviews.author: Ho Phu Hien

customer_reviews.title: Was good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a few months. Not sure why; I had to get a new (different one). Was good while it lasted. I especially liked that it could play audio files.
customer_reviews.author: Ananda Guneratne

customer_reviews.title: First reader I buy
customer_reviews.text: It's my first ebook reader and I am really satisfied. This reader has everything I needed: basic internet functionalities, vocabulary and dictionary And a great display. At 20 something dollars more than The kindle touch I think is more than worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Gero

customer_reviews.title: review on wrong item
customer_reviews.text: this should have read that it wasn't in perfect condition, but it did not claim to be works OK it seems
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Creeden

customer_reviews.title: Электронная книжка
customer_reviews.text: Книжка супер! По сравнению с версией для (грёбаной) россии, у этой другая прошивка. После обновления прошивки, появился android (что нельзя сделать на русской версии). Да и еще, экран тач скрин (или как его там). Рекомендую!
customer_reviews.author: Andrey

customer_reviews.title: great reader
customer_reviews.text: Came with no receipt or contact info but I was able to upgrade the software on it and it has been working well. I love the reader.
customer_reviews.author: angelcrafts

customer_reviews.title: Awesome eReader
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm totally satisfied with the product. It's really thin, light and easy to use. Reading is comfortable and it has lot of adjustments on display options. Viewing pictures is also great in it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin MS

customer_reviews.title: Best ereader I have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: It is very thin and it has light weight, good touch screen, ergonomic light grey e-ink screen. Easy russian localisation. It's OS is Android 2.2, so it is easy to setup any soft.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect purchase. SONY PRS-T1: Pros: 1. Very light and easy to use. 2. Good display. 3. After Rooting can read almost all popular formats 4. After Rooting I have installed some very nice and useful apps. 5. Key Panel is very useful, especially in Landscape Mode 6. Browser, Dictionary, Audio are great. 7. Good reader for PDFs. Cons: 1. Relatively small battery life. 2. With some PDFs, after zooming, page turn time is a bit long Overall 9,5 / 10
customer_reviews.author: Paplavoki

customer_reviews.title: Mother in law very happy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my mother in law and she simply loves it. Now I'm her favorite son in law. Yea
customer_reviews.author: R643

customer_reviews.title: good for what it is
customer_reviews.text: If you get this, buy the case with the light. good for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sony prs-t1
customer_reviews.text: Sony PRS-T1 6" Digital E-Ink Pearl eReader with Wi-Fi (Black) Good model, Fast delivery, but part of the screen is damaged
customer_reviews.author: George Ivanishvili

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: It is fast and clean, don't worry if you afraid because it's old version. No, i think it is the best reader
customer_reviews.author: Hamza Mohammed Zoli

customer_reviews.title: My reader satellite
customer_reviews.text: I use it very often to read books and study materials. It has enough capacity for everyday usage, however it's a little bit slow for scaling and reading pdf-books.
customer_reviews.author: YAUHENIYA S.

customer_reviews.title: Ottima scelta a 100 dollari
customer_reviews.text: Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo. NB Il reader store della Sony non ha ancora aperto in Italia, e non è possibile acquistare da quello americano con una carta di credito italiana.
customer_reviews.author: Fiorro

customer_reviews.title: Sony eReaqder
customer_reviews.text: Very good item! Easy to use, outstanding dictionaries, feels good in hand. Easily as good- or better- than other ereaders I have owned. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS L. HOLLAND

customer_reviews.title: E-reader Sony PRS T1
customer_reviews.text: I bought the reader Sony PRS T1 to read documents and books. The item is very convenient and light. Using a leather cover it looks like a real pocket book, containing a lot of information.
customer_reviews.author: Vasily Komar

customer_reviews.title: Crap firmware makes a beautiful reader useless
customer_reviews.text: Very nice screen but refuses to list books correctly, crapy software makes a beautiful reader pretty much useless so I am still looking for usable firmware or a fix while I use my old reader for my many books.
customer_reviews.author: R. Browning

customer_reviews.title: Great hw, improvable sw
customer_reviews.text: Impressive thinness and really light. But the user experience is yet to reach IT maximum. The Best ereader anyway. Buy it with confidence is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: VHA

customer_reviews.title: what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I love the search function and the translation by pushing a word. In my view one of the best ereader.
customer_reviews.author: leogal4

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Легкая. Тонкая. Приятно трогать. Качественный экран. Что обрадовало - возможность прошить ее, чтобы добавить мой родной язык. Поэтому, эту я заказал в качестве подарка.
customer_reviews.author: EVGENY

customer_reviews.title: Studies tool
customer_reviews.text: So far it's been great. I'm able to read my favourite books not concerning about book weigh and volume, also I'm able to save money inserting school papers and pdf files in it, instead of printing them. Nevertheless, after all previous advantages, I can hear too the songs that I desire and want. So, with this product, I'm definitely on a better-off situation.
customer_reviews.author: Demóstenes Segundo

customer_reviews.title: I love reading and this reader just makes it more fun
customer_reviews.text: I love reading and this reader just makes it more fun, and it is easier to download books than i ever imagined
customer_reviews.author: maurice bedard

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Sony has delivered a good ereader. Many improvements are done. Particularly speed is very good. I am very satisfied with the quality and design of this book reader.
customer_reviews.author: Khurram Bashir

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: great price for this amaziong reader ! ! ! . arribed on time and perfecly packaged . totally recommended
customer_reviews.author: Manel Martinez-Campos

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't download books because there is no more sony reader store. They default you over to kobo books but hlf of them don't download either. Piece of junk. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Craul

customer_reviews.title: Most dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a Sony PRS600 which was not great, could not read in bright sunlight and had many other problems. ANYWAY BOUGHT A PRS T1, had to return this after about 5 months, worked again for a while now has stopped again. I really cannot face returning it again and in any event not worth the expense as I live in Cyprus but i think I will avoid Sony products in the future, I was most disappointed in both the quality and the after sales service.
customer_reviews.author: DesiH

customer_reviews.title: all ok
customer_reviews.text: everything was ok with this article, delivery faster than promised, the e-reader was in a good packaging, good and fast comunication. I recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Paolo

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It's very slow and the condition it's very poor... I expected something better
customer_reviews.author: jose david

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever did
customer_reviews.text: Lags, breaks, stalls, and then expects you to pay an ADDITIONAL $30 to get it refurbished? Forget it. Get a Kindle Paperwhite and never look back. Best thing I ever did. Avid Bibliophile
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: very nice!
customer_reviews.text: just unboxed yesterday, and i must say that this device is great! I really suggest to buy it... See you Andrea
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: can't read Word file
customer_reviews.text: Bought it secondhand for $50, and unlike PRS 350 which uploads everything, it doesn't upload Microsoft 97 Word file. Doesn't show up on the menu of the device, although when I connect it to my netbook and open up the files there, the Word file icon does show up (F drive. There's also D drive, but it's protected, you can't send anything there) Can anybody help me with this? Thx.
customer_reviews.author: fantic

customer_reviews.title: imho a best 6' e-book reader
customer_reviews.text: I use this item almost 6 months and was convinced of its non-failure work and full compliance to specifications! It is very convenient and economic. Sony is Sony, and everything is told by it!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: E-reader
customer_reviews.text: I received an e-reader that doesn't work. The screen flashes when I try to do something. Now I will have to go through the process of returning it. I'm a very unhappy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Fordham

product_meta.title: Sony PRS-T1 6" Digital E-Ink Pearl eReader with Wi-Fi (Black)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER



It's here: the world's lightest 6" e-Reader with a lovably glare-free, paper-like display designed for hours of comfortable reading, even in direct sunlight. Use your fingertips to select a title, turn the page or zoom in and out. Wirelessly shop books, magazines and newspapers at Reader Store and get instantaneous access to websites like Wikipedia and Google search.

Treasure your favorite books, magazines and more on the paper-like touch screen of the world's lightest 6" e-Reader3. Get the titles you want at Reader Store or borrow from your local public library wirelessly.



Use your fingertips to select a title, turn the page or zoom in and out

THE TITLES YOU WANT ON TAP
Line the shelves of your virtual library with the hottest new releases, page-turning bestsellers and classics close to your heart. Choose the books, newspapers and magazines you want to download at Reader Store.

FEEL FREE TO BORROW
Want an eBook to read for free? Pay a virtual visit to your local library any time of the day or night without setting foot outside your home. Tap the Public Library icon to wirelessly peruse, borrow and download eBooks from local public libraries directly to the device.

WILL TRAVEL
At less than 6 ounces and lighter than most paperbacks, the small, fiercely stylish Reader Wi-Fi is the lightest 6" e-Reader there is. Simply pop it in a purse, pocket or bag and keep your reading material constantly close at hand.



The world's lightest e-Reader with a glare-free, paper-like display for comfortable reading

FETCHING DISPLAY
A simple touch to the Clear Enhanced display calls up your favorite books, while a swipe of the finger turns their pages and a pinch of two fingers can zoom in and out. Your eyes will thank you for the natural reading experience the E-Ink Pearl V220 anti-glare screen provides, especially in direct sunlight.

SERIOUS BOOK SMARTS
Tap and hold your finger on any words you don't recognize for instant access to two on-board English dictionaries, as well as 10 additional foreign language dictionaries. Use the note-taking feature to highlight important text or jot down notes with your finger or the included stylus.

A LONG, HEALTHY LIFE
Make it through your next long ride, flight or vacation without the need to plug in your Reader Wi-Fi since a single charge lasts over a month or up to 14,000 continuous page turns, whichever comes first.
feature_bullets: Borrow free books from your local public library or download Google public domain books. Plus, get immediate access to websites like Wikipedia and Google search.

With a crystal clear paper like screen, you can read for hours, even in direct sunlight. The screen has no backlight or flicker like a standard LCD screen and features 8 adjustable font sizes plus adjustable contrast and brightness

Enjoy a whole library in your hands. Store up to 1200 titles on 2GB of included memory or add optional MicroSD media to expand your storage to 32GB. Customizable file management also lets you manage your ebooks and music from within your Reader
Plug in your headphones to listen to audio books or to music as you read

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.9 out of 5 stars112 ratings2.9 out of 5 stars
